result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth B Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth B Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Kenneth B
defendant.address: N11547 Popple Hill Rd, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt:
3:29 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Kenneth B Johnson in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the court accepting the plea to Ct. 1 the charge will be amended from a Felony to a Misdemeanor. SO Ordered. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an Attorney. DE enters plea of GUILTY to the sole amended count in this matter. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 

Ct. 1 (amended)
$500 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 

Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:36 Am Da Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Kenneth Johnson appeared in person. Karl J. Kelz appeared in person for The State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history of the case and prior appearances. Defendant makes comments. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant and reinstate the previous signature bond with all conditions. Court questions DA Kelz on rescheduling the Plea and Sentencing Hearing. DA Kelz requests the defendant schedule hearing with his office off record. So Ordered.

9:30 AM DA Karl Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Kenneth B Johnson not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA gives status of case. Court questions DA. DA requests bench warrant, $500. So ordered plus warrant fee.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney
Defendant is not to keep animals

10:12 AM Defendant Kenneth B Johnson appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond ordered as requested.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
